content: The Act is titled the "Griffith Project Prepayment and Conveyance Act" and includes definitions for various terms used within the Act. The Act, titled the "Griffith Project Prepayment and Conveyance Act," defines the term "Authority" as the Southern Nevada Water Authority and the term "Griffith Project" as the Robert B. Griffith Water Project authorized by the Southern Nevada Water Project Act. The term "Acquired Land(s)" refers to all interests in land acquired for the Griffith Project under Public Law 89-292. The term "Public Land" refers to lands under the jurisdiction of the Bureau of Land Management that have never left Federal ownership. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of the Interior. The term "Withdrawn Land" refers to Federal lands reserved for a specific public purpose under certain laws and under the jurisdiction of the Bureau of Reclamation or the National Park Service. SEC. 3. CONVEYANCE OF GRIFFITH PROJECT. The Authority will assume liability for the Griffith Project from the United States upon prepayment of $121,204,348. The Secretary will convey all rights, title, and interest in project improvements, facilities, and acquired lands to the Authority. The Authority will assume liability for the Griffith Project from the United States upon prepayment of $121,204,348. The Authority will receive all rights, title, and interest in project improvements, facilities, acquired lands, and reserved interests for the Griffith Project. Additionally, the Authority will have a right-of-way across Public Land, Withdrawn Land, and Federal lands necessary for the operation and maintenance of the Griffith Project. The Authority will have a right-of-way across Public Land, Withdrawn Land, and Federal lands for the Griffith Project without cost, valid for municipal water supply purposes. Within twelve months, the Secretary and the Authority will agree on the land description and memorialize the rights-of-way. The Secretary and the Authority will agree on the land description for the rights-of-way within twelve months. If the conveyance does not occur within this timeframe, the Secretary will report to Congress on the status. SEC. 4. RELATIONSHIP TO EXISTING CONTRACTS. The Secretary and the Authority may modify contracts and permits to comply with this Act. SEC. 5. RELATIONSHIP TO OTHER LAWS AND FUTURE BENEFITS. Upon conveyance of the Griffith Project, all applicable laws and regulations must be followed. The project will no longer receive Reclamation benefits and will cease to be a Federal Reclamation Project. Federal ownership and rights in Lake Mead National Recreation Area will not be affected. Upon conveyance of the Griffith Project, it will no longer be a Federal Reclamation Project. Federal ownership and rights in Lake Mead National Recreation Area will remain unaffected. Upon conveyance of the Griffith Project, Federal reclamation law will still apply to water delivered to the Authority. The United States will not be liable for any damages related to its prior ownership of the conveyed property.
